definition: to go forward together (idiom); to undertake simultaneous tasks/going hand in hand
(name of states and dynasties at several different periods)/surname Qi
neat/even/level with/identical/simultaneous/all together/to even sth out
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
and/furthermore/also/together with/(not) at all/simultaneously/to combine/to join/to merge
to combine/to amalgamate
variant of 並|并[bing4]
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: Horse Racing and Thoroughbred Sales go hand in hand at Magic Millions.
sentences.chinese: 赛马及良种销售齐头并进，在魔术数百万人。

sentences.english: The right way to reduce our excess nuclear forces is in parallel with Russia.
sentences.chinese: 减少我们过剩核力量的正确途径是与俄罗斯齐头并进。

sentences.english: Work and rest go together, hand in hand.
sentences.chinese: 工作和休息齐头并进，相得益彰。

sentences.english: And it does not align IT and the business.
sentences.chinese: 而且它不能让IT与业务保持齐头并进。

sentences.english: At the end of the fourth lap, Sun Mei and I were neck and neck.
sentences.chinese: 在第四圈的最后一段，孙梅和我齐头并进。

sentences.english: They travel in tight packs, sometimes as many as 20 abreast.
sentences.chinese: 他们密集穿行，有时候多达20辆车齐头并进。

sentences.english: In terms of improving access to medicines, price and quality go hand in hand.
sentences.chinese: 在改进药品的获得性方面，价格和质量齐头并进。

sentences.english: Education and health go hand in hand.
As the horses raced towards the finishing post, there was nothing in it.
sentences.chinese: 临近终点时，那几匹马齐头并进，简直分不出先后。

definition: to run neck and neck/to keep pace with/to keep abreast of/on a par with one another
to advance together
friendly one-upmanship/to try to emulate
to advance singing loudly (idiom); triumphant progress
to fly wing to wing (idiom)/two hearts beating as one/(of a couple) inseparable
to take the lead in a race/to set the pace
at the same time/simultaneously/(when stating a quantity that is a round number) exactly
to advance boldly/to push ahead vigorously
to proceed in parallel/side by side (of two processes, developments, thoughts etc)
the very front
to pursue/to chase after/to accelerate/to catch up with/to overtake
see 勢不可當|势不可当[shi4 bu4 ke3 dang1]
lit. late-comer lives above (idiom); the up-and-coming youngster outstrips the older generation/the pupil surpasses the master
to develop simultaneously/to undertake concurrently
impossible to resist (idiom); an irresistible force
like a hot knife through butter (idiom)/with irresistible force
